title: Ban everyone from eating or drinking on trains and buses to end snack culture, says chief medical officer
text:
Eating or drinking on trains and buses should be banned, in a bid to end Britain’s “mindless” snack culture, the country’s Chief Medical Officer has said, in her final report.

Prof Dame Sally Davies also called for a slew of extra taxes on sugary and unhealthy foods.

And she said chocolates and crisps should be put in plain packaging, to reduce temptation, as has happened for cigarettes.

The damning review says children are "drowning in a flood of unhealthy food and drink options" which has fuelled a doubling in obesity in three decades.

But critics said the measures thought up by Dame Sally, who has previously dubbed herself “chief nanny,” were “the silliest and most authoritarian” ideas yet.

The radical proposals include an extension of the sugar tax to cover milkshakes and flavoured coffees and an overhaul of VAT so all unhealthy fare is consistently covered.
